title: Can Boris Johnson get his deal through Parliament without the support of the DUP?
text:
Boris Johnson’s hopes of getting his Brexit deal through parliament have been dealt a blow by the DUP’s insistence that they can't support his proposals as they currently stand.

However, due to the more positive mood music emanating from other parliamentary factions, the Prime Minister might not necessarily need the 10 DUP MP's support.

The introduction of the Benn Act means that Mr Johnson’s best hope of fulfilling his promise to leave the EU by the end of October rests on passing a deal.

After finalising an agreement at today’s EU summit, he will attempt to get it through parliament on Saturday in what would be MPs fourth meaningful vote on a Brexit deal.

The first three of these votes - all...
description: Boris Johnson’s hopes of getting his Brexit deal through parliament have been dealt a blow by the DUP’s insistence that they can't support his proposals as they currently stand.
